result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell L Wachsmuth

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Mitchell L Wachsmuth
Current: 1943 Water Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 03-07-2016)
Prior: 3511 Evergreen Dr, Apt 6, Plover, WI 54467 United States

11: 05 a.m. Defendant Mitchell L Wachsmuth in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
14CF192 Count 1 - OWI 2nd :  22 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence. $450 fine + costs = $1,505.00 fine/costs. $26.45 blood draw costs. 15 mo revocation, 15 mo IID, DOT/AODA.
14CF192 Count 2 - to be dismissed.
14CF192 Count 3 - Bail-felony:  W/H Sentence: 12 mo Probation, concurrent: Comply with current probation conditions.
14CF332 Bail Jump - to be DRI
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF192 Count 1 and 3: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF192 Count 1 and 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 
14CF192 Count 2 is dismissed and 14CF332 is Dismissed Read In.

ADA Cousins states joint sentencing arguments are guideline for the reading of .170% to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt concurs and states there is 3 days credit. 
ADA Cousins agrees with 3 days credit.
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:*******************
14CF192 Count 1:  OWI 2nd
 22 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence. 3 days credit and Huber for work, counseling or any other reason the jail will allow.  60 days to report but go today to get start date.
$450 fine + costs = $1,505.00 fine/costs.   Pay 60 days
$26.45 blood draw costs. 
15 mo revocation 
15 mo IID
DOT/AODA.

***14CF192 Count 3:  I/S Sentence:  30 days  jail - stayed; 12 mo PROBATION, concurrent: Comply with current probation conditions.  Pay costs + DNA  Surcharge.
/s/TBE - $350 forfeited - LR

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.

$250.00 cash bond on each file, with same conditions:  
Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License.  Comply with all bond conditions in any other pending cases.

Defendant Mitchell L Wachsmuth appears by video, and with Karl Schmidt .   Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:59 a.m.  Court calls cases and states appearances.   Appearance on  Cases 14CF192 and 14CF332.  Court states this matter was scheduled for a plea on February 11, 2015, and Mr. Wachsmuth did not appear.  Atty Schmidt states the reasons for his non appearance.  The Defendant states he did not have notice of the hearings.  Atty Schmidt states the Defendant did submit a new address to the Clerk of Courts on February 2, 2015.   Atty Cousins states the Respondent was present for a pretrial on February 2, 2015 when the Plea Hearing was scheduled, and makes further statements.

Atty Cousins requests a $1,000.00 cash bond on each file

BTC:  Court orders a $250.00 cash bond on each file, with same conditions.  

Another Plea Hearing is to be rescheduled in Branch I.  Atty Schmidt states he has only been appointed on the 14CF192 file, as the Defendant did not qualify for a Public Defender on 14CF332.

sent to JR 2/11/15 ks

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Ryan Drengler in Court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF192, 14CF332 

9:34 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Drengler indicates he has had no contact with his client.  Asks to withdraw on both files. 
Atty Cousins requests a bench warrant. 

BY THE COURT:  Bench warrant.  Any bond posted is ordered forfeited.  Request to withdraw is granted.
Plea hearing on February 11, 2015 at 08:03 am.

Defendant Mitchell L Wachsmuth in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Mitchell L Wachsmuth appeared by video.  Attorney Acalia Halverson in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews the file. 
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed. 

Atty Cousins recommends bond. 
Atty Halverson makes statements. 
Court questions Atty Cousins. 
Atty Cousins indicates there was an officer subpeonad.
Defendant states he'd like to have a signature bond set and would waive his preliminary hearing. 
Court advises defendant he cannot take the waiver today, he must speak to his attorney. 

BY THE COURT:  Court continues the $350 cash bond.  State given 10 days to determine if the officer was on duty or not.  If the officer was not, the defendant would have to pay the witness fee and mileage within 30 days. 

Defendant asks the Court for clarification. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
